comments: Participation in Carleton OCS Berlin Program
summary: Berlin is the center of a transnational space that is German, European and global. This course will examine Berlin's complicated history and culture through its monuments, museums, and other sites of commemoration. Using Berlin as our text, we will gain insights into the significant historical events that shaped the society and culture of Germany's capital city. On visits to nearby cities, such as Prague and Warsaw, we will also discuss developments in Germany and Europe more generally.
title: Berlin Program: A German Crucible of European and Global Culture
